title: Greg Mulcahy
text:
Greg Mulcahy is an American novelist and short-story writer. 
Early life.
Mulcahy was born in <a href="St.%20Paul%2C%20Minnesota">St. Paul, Minnesota</a> in 1958. 
Career.
Mulcahy's collection "Out of Work" was published by <a href="Alfred%20A.%20Knopf">Alfred A. Knopf</a> in 1993. It included a novella, "Glass". 
His first novel, "Constellation", was published in 1996. 
A second collection of stories, "Carbine", was released in 2010 by <a href="University%20of%20Massachusetts%20Press">University of Massachusetts Press</a> as part of its Juniper Prize for Fiction series.
A second novel, "O'Hearn", was released in 2015. "Kirkus Reviews" called it "an inventive but ultimately thin portrayal of workplace despair." 
His short fiction appeared frequently in <a href="Gordon%20Lish">Gordon Lish</a>'s "The Quarterly" and frequently appears in <a href="Diane%20Williams%20%28author%29">Diane Williams</a>'s "<a href="Noon%20%28Literary%20Annual%29">NOON</a>". His fiction has also been featured in such journals as "Elimae", "New York Tyrant", "Caliban", "The Gettysburg Review", "Juked", "Alice Blue Review", "Sidebrow", "Five Rrope", and "Word Riot".
